item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Math is still catching up to the genius of Ramanujan (172 points | 91 comments)
2. LTESniffer: An Open-Source LTE Downlink/Uplink Eavesdropper (35 points | 1 comment)
3. First images from Euclid are in (227 points | 74 comments)
4. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (229 points | 89 comments)
5. Scalene: A high-performance, high-precision CPU, GPU, memory profiler for Python (55 points | 4 comments)
6. Show HN: Data Formulator – AI-powered data visualization from Microsoft Research (38 points | 1 comment)
7. Transitioning the Use of Cryptographic Algorithms and Key Lengths (47 points | 19 comments)
8. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (123 points | 57 comments)
9. Thought experiments that fray the fabric of space-time (64 points | 72 comments)
10. Show HN: Epublifier – scrape pages (books, manuals) for offline reading (256 points | 40 comments)
11. Mind Wandering: More than a Bad Habit (2018) [pdf] (54 points | 21 comments)
12. New discovery reveals how diatoms capture CO2 so effectively (37 points | 5 comments)
13. Are you tasty to mosquitoes? Study offers clues into when and why they bite (8 points | 3 comments)
14. Building a Game with the Real Engine (5 points | discuss)
15. Learning to Learn (9 points | 1 comment)
16. Wired's Attack on Privacy (40 points | 7 comments)
17. Apple's AirPods Pro hearing health features are as good as they sound (57 points | 20 comments)
18. Show HN: Floating point arithmetic types in C++ for any size and any base (65 points | 22 comments)
19. Transformers Utilization in Chart Understanding: A Review of Advances and Future (5 points | discuss)
20. Please do not write below the line (272 points | 226 comments)
21. Ask HN: In 2024 what's the best way to manage contacts? (25 points | 21 comments)
22. World-first therapy using donor cells sends autoimmune diseases into remission (15 points | 3 comments)
23. Egypt declared malaria-free after 100-year effort (517 points | 55 comments)
24. IOCCC Flight Simulator (2010) (149 points | 22 comments)
25. Scientists working to decode birdsong (138 points | 123 comments)
26. ByteDance sacks intern for sabotaging AI project (131 points | 158 comments)
27. Workaround Clang v15 AArch64 miscompile that affects parallel collection (60 points | 7 comments)
28. Software Engineering Body of Knowledge (SWEBOK) v4.0 is out [pdf] (132 points | 77 comments)
29. Civet: A Superset of TypeScript (69 points | 52 comments)
30. Morsle – A daily Morse code challenge (107 points | 34 comments)
